subject: just for now
body: yesterday evening d made some off-hand reference to me disliking imogen heap, which in one sense is understandable because i dislike many people/musicians and make over-emphatic statements to d about that all the time, but in this case it didn't resonate with me because besides knowing imogen heap's name and that she did some kind of electronic pop, i didn't know anything about her and couldn't name one of her songs, and so i'm thankful for the lovely looped landscapes of her song "[just for now](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5yBBaK1vGh4)", and especially for the live versions of the song [by heap fan ariana grande](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=syw1L7_JYf0) (seven years ago, in a little bedroom in the retro intimacy of standard definition, playing "foot petals" with her hands) and [heap herself](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=25VGdNU3nrU) (the layers and the galloping rhythm as it builds and builds). i'm thankful for when it turns out i like something instead of disliking it.
normalized_markdown: yesterday evening d made some off-hand reference to me disliking imogen heap, which in one sense is understandable because i dislike many people/musicians and make over-emphatic statements to d about that all the time, but in this case it didn't resonate with me because besides knowing imogen heap's name and that she did some kind of electronic pop, i didn't know anything about her and couldn't name one of her songs, and so i'm thankful for the lovely looped landscapes of her song "[just for now](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5yBBaK1vGh4)", and especially for the live versions of the song [by heap fan ariana grande](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=syw1L7_JYf0) (seven years ago, in a little bedroom in the retro intimacy of standard definition, playing "foot petals" with her hands) and [heap herself](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=25VGdNU3nrU) (the layers and the galloping rhythm as it builds and builds). i'm thankful for when it turns out i like something instead of disliking it.
